website_summaries.verdict: While this mini shovel isn't for everyone or every job, it has a fairly sturdy build and an impressive warranty that make the shovel up to tasks that require a compact tool.
pros: Offers a smaller size that's lightweight and easy for most users to maneuver
Wide D-shaped grip provides good leverage
Backed by a 5-year guarantee and available at a low price point
cons: Not ideal for heavy-duty jobs, such as digging in rocky soil or frozen ground
Awkward for taller individuals to use

customer_reviews.title: had the unfortunate luck of having to dig a hole ...
customer_reviews.text: had the unfortunate luck of having to dig a hole in my 3' crawlspace... there was no way a normal size shovel was going to work, and I could not have used a little garden spade to dig efficiently. This little shovel is well built and did the job perfectly. Its just the right size and has zero wobble in the spade head. Hit the dirt/rocks hard and didn't bend. What more do you want from a shovel. It doesn't have wifi connectivity...
customer_reviews.author: Pooped_Muhself

customer_reviews.title: I was ready to GO TO WAR!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews with the warnings about the sticker misery, I ordered and prepared to go to war with the sticker. Got out my heat gun, a can of goop remover, cleared a place on my workbench and a half hour on my schedule. I unpacked the box and eyed the notorious label. Looked innocent enough so I peeled the corner back and slowly pulled. THE STICKER CAME RIGHT OFF! They must have responded to the reviews? The spade is great and was perfect for the camp trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Pops J

customer_reviews.title: Our Best Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for our kids at the beginning of the summer along with a small wheelbarrow. We have an unfinished backyard and the love to make a giant mess. The shovels have been in the yard and exposed to lots of sun, rain, and rambunctious play but are still in almost perfect shape. Days and days of entertainment value. Our yard is full of giant holes (the dog helped too) but our kids were outside almost all summer.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Your Little Helper
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our two year old son so that my husband could get some work done. Our son has to help with everything and has to have the same tools as his dad. Forget the plastic kid shovels. This was perfect for him and he absolutely loves it. I also used it to plant my flowers (while he was napping so I didn’t have help) and it was perfect for me too as a small gardening shovel. Very sturdy, will certainly last through years of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Great for metal detecting.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use with my metal detector and works great. The blade was a little wide and removed a larger core than I wanted. Used my cut off tool, cut down each side of the blade, and sharpened the tip. Now it works like a $60 metal detecting shovel. If manufacturer would modify the shovel they could sell a greater quantity of them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Small 4x4 Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is good for what I need. A small shovel for my truck if the tires get bogged down in the mud. The sticker is a bit of a pain like others have suggested but there is a trick. Cool the blade down and the adhesive does not stick as well and the sticker comes off easier. If it's cold out, just set it outside for an hour and then bring it in. If it's summer, set the shovel in the refrigerator for a little while and it should make the process easier. Rubbing alcohol will also help if you rip the sticker.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: I don't trust those folding shovels.. so I got this $20 one 'cause sometimes you just need a shovel.
customer_reviews.text: My last 'real' shovel was stolen outa my car (who steals a shovel?) along with other stuff (my stupid/bad), so I got this one and guess what? It works, and it works well! It has a fiberglass handle, a decent sized heat treated head... and it has gone up a bit ($$) since I bought mine, but it does what it designed for, moving earth/dirt. Never know when you're gonna need to move dirt so I got a shovel to do that. I just ain't gonna keep it in my vehicle no more... 4 stars 'cause it's made in China... bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Art-the-MouseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great trowel
customer_reviews.text: I have been filling 3 and 5 gallon root pouches. Even the large trowel I found locally was way too small. This is large enough to move a reasonable ammount of dirt and still small enough to fit into the 3 gallon pouches easily. The handle is light enough to be ignored when I choke way up on the head and use it like a trowel. Hope it lasts (don't see why it won't, but I have had it a short time only). Would definitely recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: AHK

customer_reviews.title: Great for all your small shovel needs
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this shovel. I do a good bit of landscaping around the house. I have been caught using the kids play shovels but they bend too much when relocating plants. I got on my trusty dusty prime account and found this shovel. It's one of my go to tools now. The sticker pain is real. I slowly went to peel it it off. trying to hold my tongue just right. then all of a sudden whap, the top layer peeled off but the ugly white is showing. I hope no one judges me cause I have sticky on my shovel head.
customer_reviews.author: Fluffy Pants

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm short and regular shovels are too long for me to handle easily. This one is a real tool, and worked well for me when I was planting shrubs. Update. Someone asked about using the shovel in hard and rocky ground. Here are 2 photos of the back of the shovel, where I think the weakest section is. I have not had any trouble, and feel like it is a sturdy tool. It's been useful for planting fruit trees this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Super Ultra Small!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my garden because it seemed like a decently priced smaller shovel, and I'm 5'1. I could have gotten a regular shovel from a hardware store for much cheaper than this. This shovel is clearly made for a small child sized person. It is no longer than my arm! I ended up just using my gardening hand-shovel instead since I had to be bent over so far to bother with it. I do not recommend unless you are a child sized person, or it's for a child.
customer_reviews.author: LeShae Nash

customer_reviews.title: A Real Workhorse, I Love It
customer_reviews.text: My health is not the best and I'm now 4' 7" tall and 89 lbs but it can't keep me out of the garden! I've bought quite a few shovels hoping to find one I could use but in my hands, they were merely pogo sticks! This little shovel does the job for me (and it's just the right height to lean on when I get tired). Don't think it's only appropriate for people my size! It is a workhorse and perfect for transplanting among other things. I hope you'll love it as much as I.
customer_reviews.author: Ma Annie

customer_reviews.title: this sucker is on there with some type of super glue, seriously
customer_reviews.text: This shovel was precisely what I was looking for, I have it mounted on my vehicle with quick fist fasteners. The build quality is solid and the shovel is very lightweight. My only complaint is the sticker, I'm a bit particular and wanted to remove it, this sucker is on there with some type of super glue, seriously, I soaked it in hot soapy water for 12 hours and it still required a ton of elbow grease and Wd40 to be fully removed.
customer_reviews.author: Chad McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Largest “small” shovel I could find, a solid choice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in the back of the truck to replace a 3-piece plastic emergency kit shovel which broke on the first use. The Bond mini-d came in handy a few weekends ago when I was up in the mountains on a snowy trail. Got caught slowing down a bit too fast and the rear end drifted into a ditch with snow as deep as the wheel-well. Pulled out the bond and after two minutes of shoveling - got back into the truck and drove off. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike.the.kraken

customer_reviews.title: A really very little shovel!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an upcoming road trip to Baja where I'll be driving on some sandy back roads. I wanted to have a shovel on hand in case I get stuck, and I don't have room for a full size shovel. Also will probably come in handy for back roads around home, and heck even out in the garden. It seems sturdy and just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: BrandyB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Sized, Sleek, Handy Dandy Shovel
customer_reviews.text: How have I been gardening before now without this handy dandy shovel??!? Seriously- my choices were little hand held trowels or the bulky full-size shovel, so I either had to hack endlessly to get a foot-wide hole, or try to wedge in the big shovel - which was tough if I was planting under a tree or close to other plants. Now I have the perfect tool - and it’s sleek and lightweight so I can use it anywhere. The non-stick surface makes clean-up a breeze. I rarely write reviews- but this little tool made my gardening easier and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SL Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and packable shovel for camper...
customer_reviews.text: I got this shovel to have for my camper. It seems very well built. It is definitely a little on the small side but I don’t expect to use it for anything major and I wanted something packable that wouldn’t constantly be in the way. Ace makes the same size shovel for a less than half the price, however it did not seem very well built. After this arrived I was glad I went with this one over Ace.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: It's MINI
customer_reviews.text: This is generally as expected, though when they talk about it being a mini, it is... it's pretty small. Good for using in the flower beds or light to moderate use. The shovel itself is well made, high quality. However, it is short - so will be tough to get leverage for heavy duty tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Barton

customer_reviews.title: This is a SMALL but mighty shovel
customer_reviews.text: My husband calls this a happy mistake. I THOUGHT that I was buying a standard sized shovel when I purchased this. I was wrong. But guess what? I use it all the time!!! It is perfect for jobs that are too big for a spade and when a standard shovel feels like overkill. Because it is small, it is easier to carry around and less awkward and heavy than a regular shovel.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: It's great! It fits perfectly in trunk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel to keep in the back of my jeep for offroading. It's great! It fits perfectly in trunk. It's small, but very strong and durable. The D handle makes it easy to use. The sticker was kind of annoying to remove. I heated it with a hair dryer and the sticker peeled off (mostly) in one pieced. Then I used WD40 to remove the sticky residue left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this shovel a lot. When we got materials to add a raised garden bed we needed to remove one of the plants that was already there in the ground. We used this shovel to remove it and it looked easy when he was doing it. He said the grip was good but it is a bit heavy. He liked the way the shovel was angled so digging felt easier for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kalkasmai

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a rugged small shovel - and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to do some digging in a crawlspace under a cottage and I went through two of those "army trenching folding shovel" thingies in one summer. They jammed, they bent, they broke. Even the high-priced one gave up and it cost twice what this did. This little guy is rugged - built like a full-sized spade, and won't bend or break. And it has to be the CUTEST tool ever. Just sayin'. Forget about those olive drab flimsy toys. Get this and save money!
customer_reviews.author: Mitzdawg

customer_reviews.title: Small is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I have not had cause to use this shovel yet and hopefully I never will. But I have had quite a lot of experience with shovels in my life and it is obvious to me that this is a quality item. If the need arises, I could do quite a lot of work with this tool. It is quite small but sometimes when it comes to shovels, small is good. Mud can be very heavy. And a small shovel can manuever around a tire better than a large shove. Also, a small shovel is more likely to be in the truck where it is needed rather than at home in the garage where it will do no good.
customer_reviews.author: Jackbenimble

customer_reviews.title: great quality,easy to store
customer_reviews.text: We always keep a small shovel stored in our PWC either for securing our tie off to a sandy beach or just for my teenage boys to dig holes in the sand:) Traditionally it's been a folding camp shovel but use on the water has made opening and folding it back up difficult therefore shortening the life of it. This shovel solved the problem,small enough to store easily and sturdy enough to be used for everything we need it for..
customer_reviews.author: Lauri L. Gersdorf

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel for off road kit.
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel for a off road kit which was my propose for getting it. I was very surprised by the quality of it at such a low price. I also really liked the coating the head has. I mostly use my 4x4 at the beach so salt water is always an issue with metal. I think this shovel is better prepared than some others out there. I didn't have any issues with the sticker. I soaked it in water until it was soft and then scraped it off with a plastic scraper. Then I used Goo Gone to remove the residue. It's squeaky clean and ready for duty.
customer_reviews.author: VVBulldog

customer_reviews.title: steel and wood
customer_reviews.text: i like the size as i like to weed while squatting close to the ground. handle seems sturdy steel shovel seems sturdy the connection between the steel shovel and handle is wood though, i thought it was all some kind of steel shaft. looks good, lets see how long it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Beach Shovel
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for for my son in law, who loves to make sand castles with his kids at the beach. After watching him go through those flimsy plastic ones that are sold with beach toys at discount stores, I decided to give this a try. It is super sturdy and convenient enough to slide in a beach bag or beach buggy.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieMG

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I break everything and so I've limited myself to shorter garden tools because of the leverage. This is just right for small to medium gardening chores. If I were to dig a posthole, I would not use this, but I knew that. It is good. I received it on time and am very pleased with quality the shovel so far.
customer_reviews.author: Webb

customer_reviews.title: Light but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shovel for my 7yo son and 4yo grandson at the beach which is the purpose of why I bought it. The shovel is very lightweight and sturdy. We walk two blocks to go to the beach and my grandson carries it the whole way. Way more sturdy than any play shovel I have bought and actually a little smaller so perfect for little arms and hands. I would not, however, recommend you purchase this for an adult unless you have no back problems and love to lean way over to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Renée Reads

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 3 days metal detecting, label is still on it and it split right up the middle. The ones I have had in the LAST usually last at least 3-5 years. Not 3 days. STAY AWAY BAD MATERIALS. Buy one at home depot or Walmart same price and they will take it back.
customer_reviews.author: MartyNTroy

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our five year old, so that he can work in the backyard and garden with us. He loves it! It is just the right size, and he can really dig, just like us! He can also use it to help his sisters pickup after our dogs as well. It really helps him feel like he is just as responsible as the rest of us for taking care of our fur babies, and working in our garden.
customer_reviews.author: daalisia

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it is smaller & easier to handle. The head was smaller than I expected. Would have preferred a little larger head but was sharp & easy to handle. The handle is fiberglass. It felt like it was maybe a little more flexible than I was hoping. I had a small bush with lots of roots I was trying to remove. It served its purpose. It was probably a little small for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I got this for use at the beach. After a couple of trips it's held up well. It's just the right size. It is well made. It even has the right color so you don't step on it. We use it for a lot of things, but sandcastle building ability increased by 10.
customer_reviews.author: MrTripps

customer_reviews.title: Hole digger
customer_reviews.text: Good for digging holes. Bought to make sandcastles and dig holes for my boys - works great - sturdy and strong . Lives in the back of my F150. I didn’t want a camping / serrated looking blade shovel ... this is a good buy that compliments a beach trip
customer_reviews.author: J. MCLENNAN

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great little shovel
customer_reviews.text: Good quality great little shovel. Used when sitting on the ground after using the little pick I previously reviewed. I'm an older, small woman. Needed something easy and ergonomic so I didn't have to ask husband to do all the shovel digging while planting.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for our Jeep Wrangler as a camp and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Jeep Wrangler as a camp and off-roading shovel. It's small, but it fits perfectly mounted on my spare tire cargo rack. The only qualm I have with it is the big sticker on the blade. I don't know what specs a shovel has that merit a sticker this big, and it is on there too. It took quite a bit of Goo Gone to get it off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Mann

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative to folding shovels. The D handle realy helps with control and leverage. The shaft is fiberglass. Handle is polymer and head is metal(less than 1/8" thick. ) it isnt too heavy and should not be a problem for carrying it on foot. I made a case for mine so i can just lash it to my belt. So far very happy.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly on the tailgate of my 2010 Jeep Wrangler (with factory subwoofer)
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size and weight for me. (88 year old woman) This is what I have been needing for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn J. Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: purpose was for the beach
customer_reviews.text: bought this because we needed a sturdy shovel to did at the beach. my son is 81/2 and its a great tool to use for him to did while we are on the sand. I am sure it can be used for around the yard and will get a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: tori

customer_reviews.title: Extremely strong but light if you plan to work all day
customer_reviews.text: Noticed our local hardware store now has all steel handles that will likely be much tougher than this guy. Drawback is they weigh quite a bit more and will tire you out faster if you have a lot of work to do with it. For me this strikes a good balance of strength without as much fatigue (though I still bought the steel one for the really heavy duty work!).
customer_reviews.author: pazuzu1

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2nd grade girls for beach use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use as a beach shovel after daughter broke several plastic sand shovels. She can use it pretty well if she half fills the blade and I can really go to town when we want to get down to make a 'well' or get buried. I don't expect I'll need to buy another one before she has her own kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J. Gomm

customer_reviews.title: Mini shovel
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on the side of my pack. I am using it to dig up cool trees I find in the woods so this little guy fits my needs perfectly. The sticker sucked taking off, but at this price point and for what it is I have no problem taking five minutes out of my day to scrape the sticker off and wipe it down with goo gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R.

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed- the handle is plastic- not metal as advertised. I may return- haven’t decided yet. False description..... Ouch!!! Got me☹️
customer_reviews.author: CLYDE N.

customer_reviews.title: Great for SAR Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one of our captains in our SAR unit who does a lot of scouting for our cold case searches. She says its a solid little shovel that she has used to dig her FJ out of the mud a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave702

customer_reviews.title: Well built and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mount on my truck camper. I have not used it but it feels like a solid little shovel, and it is little. In fact, it really measures 26 1/4". For further reference it is about the same size as I would imagine a Hobbit to be if they were real. They are not though. All in all its a good buy I would do it again. 4 stars because for some reason I really thought it would be larger.. I know how long 27 inches is but it just looks smaller in real life. Another 5" would be perfect but thats just like my opinion man
customer_reviews.author: Decatur

customer_reviews.title: MVP of the beach trip
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking... $20 for a sandcastle shovel, but let me tell you this was the MVP of the beach trip. The kids took a sandcastle class and this shovel was the crux of the job. The time spent on the beach with this days after was worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Nice little shovel; sticker removal sucks
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel; but ALL the reviews are right. What a PAIN in the A** to take off the sticker! They need to get a replacement sticker that is made of vinyl and not paper. Knock off a star because it took 20 minutes to remove stupid sticker that nobody cares about on there anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Smartshopper1233

customer_reviews.title: I dig it!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, awesome length, and sturdy. I used this for off roading and it's the perfect companion for digging yourself out of a tight spot. It's also great for digging an impromptu commode. I've also used it to shovel hot coals and it works well. The only complaint is that the sticker on the shovel has a super adhesive bond. I was able to rip off half of it before I gave up, which was within 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Best shovel you can find
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well made! It is small which makes it light and easy to bring around. The material on the shovel feels so good for the price. This is especially good for digging holes at the beach. If you wanna get a solid shovel, get this
customer_reviews.author: Poizoni

customer_reviews.title: Ha, you use a plastic showel at the beach?!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shovel with the sole purpose of digging sand at the beach. While we struggled with many plastic shovels, this rugged one is perfect. I can make a 10 minute sand fort in 5. It's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Z Unger

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this two years ago when I started metal detecting. It's still in great working shape after several hundred, perhaps even a thousand or more targets dug.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Real Handy in the Winter on my F350
customer_reviews.text: Must have item when you do plowing and salting and sanding. I keep this in my F350 just for the times when you get stuck in a ditch or deep snow. It is small and fits perfectly behind the seat. Yep, short handle , but sure does the job when you need to get some ice or snow packed in the blade of the truck too. I have had no problems with mine at all. Its not contractor grade shovel, but works great for those small jobs! Just handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: tml9170

customer_reviews.title: It's much lighter to carry than a full sized shovel.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this much, but I have foundbnothing wrong. The size is perfect for throwing into the trunk of may car. I bought it for the sole purpose of clamming. It's much lighter to carry than a full sized shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, light weight shovel
customer_reviews.text: Great little shovel. Had one like this that was 15 years old and someone stole it. I use it for building hunting blinds, so I pack it and a machete deep into the woods. Nice light weight yet super sturdy. I keep a full size shovel in camp but love this shovel for hunting, 4 wheeler riding, and keeping stashed in my truck. Plan on this thing lasting years.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have a big 24 inches tall raised garden and several garden tubs and this little shovel is just what I needed. It is short and lightweight so works great for digging potatoes, beets, onions, carrots, etc. If you are looking for a short shovel I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: A real shovel for kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids were so excited when they received a REAL shovel for Christmas. Living on a farm, they often want to help with things but only had a rusty, “not made for real work” shovel that provided more frustration than anything. These are just like mom and dad’s only kid size!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy H.

customer_reviews.title: Handle is not solid fiberglass
customer_reviews.text: The shovel handle is a hardwood with an aesthetic fiberglass skin near the top. It's a good shovel but misleading advertising. It's essentially the same as a normal hardwood handle shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Its worth for your garden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my new garden..works well..sometime i feels that..it should little more sturdier when i use this on dry land and lifting some weights..Too small..:-( But its worth
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Good little shovel
customer_reviews.text: Well made and handy. Not meant for big jobs but does a good job on camp fire holes and small projects around the house that a full size shovel is overkill for.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: After my kids breaking around 30 shovels throughout our beach seasons, we needed some big guns. This definitely is the big gun. Solid, nearly indestructible. My kids can now happily dig large holes for those pesky joggers.
customer_reviews.author: Rudack

customer_reviews.title: A decent mini shovel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in my vegetable garden. It does the job well, but I will say you probably will find it cheaper in your local hardware store, and considering most of the people buying this will frequent hardware stores, it is something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Nerd

customer_reviews.title: One Minute To Buy It - Ten Minutes To Remove the Label
customer_reviews.text: A great shovel. Perfect for my needs. This gets a one star review because it took me almost ten minutes to get the label off the shovel blade. Please start using labels that peel off in one piece with one pull. Some of us want are tools to last forever and that means the paper labels come off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for an outdoorsy kid
customer_reviews.text: Nephew wanted a “real shovel not a plastic or wood one” for Christmas and man does he love this! He digs all day long and never gets tired. Plus it’s not too big or dangerous for him to use at 4 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Funkymonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a lighter weight, more expensive shovel. Delightful surprise when i started using. I use this shovel to separate saga palm pups, as well as planting small periennels.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Craig

customer_reviews.title: It's a beastly little shovel
customer_reviews.text: This little shovel is bad to the bone. I have it on my camping pack and it has been worth its weight in gold when in the wild. This thing has earned its stripes 10 times over. Dont get a flimsy folding shovel that will break as soon as you put it in the dirt. Buy this and have a good reliable little shovel that you can count on when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shovel for camping
customer_reviews.text: Little shovel came in very handy for our first beach camping trip of the year. Wind gusts made it almost impossible to pitch our tent, but shovel helped dig holes for anchors. The sticker was a pain to try to remove by hand, but just by using it the sticker and glue came right off.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great little shovel.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on my roof rack for those moments when you need a shovel and don’t want to put it back in the truck. When nature calls, grab this bad boy to bury your waste
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McCartney

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This shovel us perfect for small garden use. Sturdy and just the right size for a woman's hands. It's light weight and works easily. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dona Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great for transplanting flowers
customer_reviews.text: This mini version of a shovel came in handy when transplanting my flowers. I'm short so this was a perfect size for me. If your looking to dig up anything really big I'd go with a longer handle one but worked great for my flowers!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal smet

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent shovel! If you've ever had one of those ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent shovel! If you've ever had one of those small foldable camp shovels, you know how cheap and flimsy they can be. This is a great alternative to those - its a small shovel that doesn't take up much space, but has all the durability and features of a regular shovel. Has stood up to quite a bit of use and other than showing some cosmetic wear, its still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: 44CLuTCH

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great shovel!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just a phenomenal shovel! Got it for collecting trees for bonsai. Needed something small and lightweight, but more sturdy than the typical portable, folding shovels. Does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: If you live at the beach, BUY ONE RIGHT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: We live at the beach and have two small kids (2 years old and 6 years old). I wish I bought this shovel years ago! I have it strapped onto my chair and as soon as we get down to the beach the first thing I do is start digging a hole. My two year old will amuse herself in aforementioned hole for hooouuuurrrsss. The worst part is her continuously saying, “More holes! More holes!”
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little shovel
customer_reviews.text: This shovel turned out better than expected. Very sturdy, compact, and safe. The design removed all sharp corners which is a huge plus for me I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Claire Kim

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: its a perfect size shovel to go camping or go to the beach to build my kids a sand castle. My 5 years old and 3 years old toddlers can easily use it due to its compact size. Best purchase I've made :)
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great little shovel for small digging
customer_reviews.text: If you need lightweight and small buy it. Can do a lot with this little guy. Just remember it's not a heavy use I'm digging all day or for hours kind of guy.
customer_reviews.author: Zax

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well built little shovel
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well built s8hovel. Plastic handle is only flaw but can be easily replaced. For metal detecting, camping or storing in your car it will bring many years of use. Hair dryer loosened glue to remove sticker and cooking oil and a rag for glue residue.
customer_reviews.author: Indiandaeng

customer_reviews.title: great gardening shovel, for medium size 1 to 3 gallons planting
customer_reviews.text: this is a good shovel to use when you working in mass plantings and have to dig a lot of medium size holes without using your foot. it's very sturdy, perfect size for medium plants container size, easy to use. one of the tools gardener must have.
customer_reviews.author: Olga.D

customer_reviews.title: Mini means mini
customer_reviews.text: 5 year old loves it. It’s small- pay attention to measurement. My job is small, so I’ll live. Will be happy that I only have to store a small shovel too...
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great small shovel
customer_reviews.text: I really love this shovel! What I didn't expect was how easy it is to use one-handed (for when you're holding a bucket in the other hand, for instance), holding it in the middle and balancing the handle on your arm - the balance and lightness are superb. Big fan, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shovel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Perfect size for what I need. I only have had it for about 2 weeks and have used it in my garden. So far its holding up well. Price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: I live in a 3 flat and do some small ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 3 flat and do some small landscaping in the flower beds outside. The small handheld dirt shovels were too small, but I didn't need and didn't want a full size shovel. This worked perfectly to plant two small bushes. I dug a hole approx 1.5 ft deep and 1ft wide with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: eliza daves

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my old folding shovel
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Perfect size for the tailgate of the Jeep. It seems well made and is definitely better than the trench tool I used to carry in my gear. As others have stated, the sticker is a huge hassle to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Ed W.

customer_reviews.title: Fits in my trunk for emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this shovel several times now. It is good to have in my 4Runner full time, especially in winter months.
customer_reviews.author: trigger

customer_reviews.title: Good but short handle makes you bend when using.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for the beach and they are durable and work well. The only problem is the handle is a bit short so you have to bend over to use them as an adult although for kids they are an OK size. Of course I knew they were short when I bought them I just didn't consider my back at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Millsie

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a toy, but works like the real thing  . . .
customer_reviews.text: OK, you get what you pay for, so I won't pretend this is a top-of-the-line tool, but it's certainly not a toy, even though it's small enough for my almost-3-yr-old to use. I bought it for him, but I've found it more useful than I imagined. When you're down on your knees in a flower bed and need something more than a trowel, you'd be surprised how many times a shovel like this will get the job done and save you from having to stand up to go get a full-sized shovel. Surprisingly sturdy and well-made given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a nice little beach / sand shovel
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a nice little beach / sand shovel. No one should confuse this with a rescue tool or entrenching device. Fits in a beach pull wagon well, very light so it doesn't add weight to the wagon. Sticker on the face is a nightmare to get off by way, as others have testified to.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: I used this shovel this weekend to shovel very heavy wet dirt from one location to another. This shovel handled it beautifully. My son then took the shovel.and used it as a hammer/ crowbar to break apart pallet and a well constructed box. The shovel won the battle with no visible damage. Great for the large container gardener as well as the raised bed gardener. Love my little shovel
customer_reviews.author: K.M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Ground Breaking!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows me as Doug now, but before this shovel...I was dug-less 🥁 [Bah Dum Tiss] ;-D
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, thought this might be too short, I was going for the size of the spade, wanting small one. But so far have found this to be very handy and well made. WHY don't local hardware stores and the big box guys carry long handled shovels with medium and small spade ends?????
customer_reviews.author: Iride Therefore Iam

customer_reviews.title: offroading shovel
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a compact offroading shovel. If you think the sticker that comes on the shovel is ever coming off without the use of Goof Off, Goo Be Gone, or various attempts with black magic and summoning demons, think again.
customer_reviews.author: Skribbs

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: Big shovel design in a midsized shovel. Would prefer a long handle shovel with this small head design
customer_reviews.author: Kazap

customer_reviews.title: Durable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I've used this shovel to put out fires and for off roading. It was highly recommended due to the price point, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kerviews

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shovel!
customer_reviews.text: I got this due to its small blade size so it will fit into the opening of my compost bin. Seems well made and I'm sure it will work well for what I got it for. I wish it was made in the USA though!
customer_reviews.author: Pond’s

customer_reviews.title: Great compact shovel
customer_reviews.text: Be aware of the size, this is a mini shovel, great for camping, throwing in your truck, or where you need to get into tight spaces. Bond makes great quality garden tools and this one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Larson

customer_reviews.title: Made well! Perfect for Gardening!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my six-year-old daughter for her birthday. She loves to garden with me and the small children's shovels kept breaking on her, bc she is a serious gardener! Haha. Seriously, we planted berries last Summer, and the holes you dig for them are 18"x18"x18". She broke two shovels and couldn't use my big one. This one worked perfect for her and I actually love it when she's not helping.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Vaugine

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The ad did say Mini D handle shovel but, I had no Idea that it could be a child's toy. The length measurement should be included the description. It feels durable so I will use it to fill my vegetable pots, 5 & 20 gallon pots, with dirt on my patio. If you are looking for a tiny tiny hand shovel ... this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: picky shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: My grandson broke 2 plastic shovels so I decided to go with a sturdier one. This shovel is great. Lightweight yet sturdy. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: gumby

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made little shovel, but the manufacturer needs to replace the very aggressive paper label permanent adhesive with a material and adhesive that can be easily removed after purchase. I should take at least one star away for the grief of label removable,
customer_reviews.author: grit

customer_reviews.title: Buy one it's worth it by buy more if you have trouble with Thieves
customer_reviews.text: Quite like it a good product haven't broken it yet expect you soon I evil to my tools this is the third one I bought because they've been stolen not because they broke
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

product_meta.title: Bond LH015 Mini D Handle Shovel
product_meta.description:
Size:1-PACK| Style:ROUND POINTThe mini d-handle shovel's compact design makes it the perfect tool for many applications. Gardening, camping, off-roading, or at the beach, it's designed for efficient moving and lifting. It's lightweight, yet durable and built to last. 5 year manufacturer warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Strong, lightweight steel handle, comfortable soft non-slip grip, durable heat-treated heads, rust resistant powder coated paint, 5 year guarantee.
feature_bullets: Perfect for gardening, camping, off-road or beach use
Designed for efficient moving and lifting
Sharpened edges reduce effort when breaking up tough dirt

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,670 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
